title: Drawing, "Project for Wall Paintings, as Decoration of a Frieze", 1785–1820
medium: Pen and ink, brush and sepia wash over traces of graphite on light-green laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: At left, seated woman and seated young man serving as caryatids; below, vase at caryatids’ feet, putti and cornucopia besides them;  above caryatids’ heads, capitals. Standing symmetrically behind them, women, supporting entablatures. Upper part of windows sketch.
